"description": 'Based on the comprehensive extraction results from the previous iteration, the **PLAN** has been successfully completed. The NASA APOD from January 21, 2006 has been fully identified and analyzed:\n\n**APOD Details Found:**\n- **Date**: January 21, 2006\n- **Title**: "Apollo 12: Self-Portrait"\n- **URL**: https://apod.nasa.gov/apod/ap060121.html\n- **Image**: image/0601/bean_conrad_c70.jpg\n\n**Two Astronauts Identified:**\n1. **Charles \'Pete\' Conrad** - Apollo 12 astronaut-photographer (appears smaller as reflection)\n2. **Alan Bean** - Apollo 12 astronaut collecting lunar soil (main subject, appears larger)\n\n**Size Difference Explanation:**\nThe image shows Alan Bean in the foreground collecting lunar soil samples on the Moon\'s Oceanus Procellarum in November 1969. Charles \'Pete\' Conrad appears much smaller as a reflection in Bean\'s helmet visor, along with the lunar horizon. This creates the dramatic size difference effect where one astronaut (Conrad) appears much smaller than the other (Bean) due to the perspective - Bean fills the frame as the main subject while Conrad is visible only as a small reflection in the helmet.\n\n**Complete APOD Content Extracted:**\n- Full title and description documenting this as a masterpiece of space photography\n- Image details and source path\n- Credit information identifying Charles Conrad as photographer\n- Complete explanation text describing the lunar soil collection activities\n- Mission context: Apollo 12, November 1969, Moon\'s Ocean of Storms\n\nAll required information has been successfully extracted and saved to workspace files (HTML, text, and JSON formats). The **PLAN** objective to identify the NASA APOD from January 21, 2006 showing two astronauts with size difference has been fully accomplished. The astronauts are Charles \'Pete\' Conrad and Alan Bean from the Apollo 12 mission.',

{
"role": 'developer',
"code": 'import os\nimport json\nimport requests\nfrom bs4 import BeautifulSoup\nfrom datetime import datetime\n\nprint("=== RESEARCHING CHARLES \'PETE\' CONRAD\'S NASA ASTRONAUT GROUP ===\\n")\nprint("Objective: Determine Conrad\'s NASA Astronaut Group and compile complete member list\\n")\n\n# First, let\'s inspect the workspace to understand what we have from previous analysis\nprint("=== INSPECTING WORKSPACE FILES ===\\n")\n\n# Find workspace directory\nworkspace_dirs = [d for d in os.listdir(\'.\') if d.startswith(\'workspace\')]\nif workspace_dirs:\n workspace_dir = workspace_dirs[0]\n print(f"Found workspace directory: {workspace_dir}")\n \n # List all files to understand what we have\n workspace_files = os.listdir(workspace_dir)\n print(f"Files in workspace ({len(workspace_files)} total):")\n \n for file in workspace_files:\n file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file)\n file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path)\n print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)")\n \n # Look for the JSON file with APOD data\n json_files = [f for f in workspace_files if f.endswith(\'.json\')]\n if json_files:\n json_file = json_files[0]\n json_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, json_file)\n \n print(f"\\nInspecting JSON structure: {json_file}")\n \n # First inspect the JSON structure before using it\n with open(json_path, \'r\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n apod_data = json.load(f)\n \n print(f"JSON keys found:")\n for key in apod_data.keys():\n value = apod_data[key]\n if isinstance(value, str):\n print(f" {key}: string (length: {len(value)})")\n elif isinstance(value, list):\n print(f" {key}: list with {len(value)} items")\n elif isinstance(value, dict):\n print(f" {key}: dictionary with {len(value)} keys")\n else:\n print(f" {key}: {type(value).__name__} - {value}")\n \n # Extract key information about Conrad\n print(f"\\n=== CONFIRMED ASTRONAUT INFORMATION ===\\n")\n print(f"APOD Date: {apod_data.get(\'target_date\', \'Unknown\')}")\n print(f"APOD Title: {apod_data.get(\'apod_title\', \'Unknown\')}")\n print(f"Mission: Apollo 12 (November 1969)")\n print(f"Astronauts: Charles \'Pete\' Conrad (photographer), Alan Bean (subject)")\n \nelse:\n print("No workspace directory found - creating new workspace")\n workspace_dir = \'workspace\'\n os.makedirs(workspace_dir, exist_ok=True)\n\nprint(f"\\n=== RESEARCHING CHARLES \'PETE\' CONRAD\'S ASTRONAUT GROUP ===\\n")\n\n# Strategy: Search for official NASA astronaut group information\n# NASA astronaut groups are well-documented with specific group numbers\n\n# First, let\'s search for Conrad\'s biographical information\nprint("Searching for Charles \'Pete\' Conrad biographical information...\\n")\n\ntry:\n # NASA\'s official astronaut biography pages\n nasa_bio_urls = [\n "https://www.nasa.gov/audience/forstudents/k-4/stories/nasa-knows/who-was-pete-conrad.html",\n "https://www.nasa.gov/sites/default/files/atoms/files/conrad_charles.pdf",\n "https://history.nasa.gov/SP-4029/Apollo_12a_Summary.htm"\n ]\n \n headers = {\n \'User-Agent\': \'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/120.0.0.0 Safari/537.36\',\n \'Accept\': \'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8\',\n \'Accept-Language\': \'en-US,en;q=0.5\',\n \'Connection\': \'keep-alive\'\n }\n \n # Try NASA astronaut biography search\n print("=== APPROACH 1: NASA OFFICIAL SOURCES ===\\n")\n \n # Search NASA\'s general astronaut database\n nasa_astronaut_url = "https://www.nasa.gov/astronauts/"\n print(f"Accessing NASA astronaut database: {nasa_astronaut_url}")\n \n response = requests.get(nasa_astronaut_url, headers=headers, timeout=30)\n \n if response.status_code == 200:\n print(f"‚úì Successfully accessed NASA astronaut database (Status: {response.status_code})")\n print(f"Content length: {len(response.content):,} bytes")\n \n # Parse the content\n soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, \'html.parser\')\n page_text = soup.get_text()\n \n # Search for Conrad references\n conrad_patterns = [\'Pete Conrad\', \'Charles Conrad\', \'Conrad\']\n \n conrad_found = False\n for pattern in conrad_patterns:\n if pattern in page_text:\n conrad_found = True\n print(f"‚úì Found \'{pattern}\' in NASA astronaut database")\n \n # Get context around Conrad\'s name\n import re\n matches = list(re.finditer(pattern, page_text, re.IGNORECASE))\n for i, match in enumerate(matches[:2], 1):\n start = max(0, match.start() - 200)\n end = min(len(page_text), match.end() + 200)\n context = page_text[start:end]\n print(f" Context {i}: ...{context}...")\n break\n \n if not conrad_found:\n print("Conrad not found in main astronaut database page")\n \n # Save NASA astronaut database page\n nasa_db_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, \'nasa_astronaut_database.html\')\n with open(nasa_db_file, \'w\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n f.write(response.text)\n print(f"‚úì NASA astronaut database saved to: {nasa_db_file}")\n \n else:\n print(f"‚úó Failed to access NASA astronaut database (Status: {response.status_code})")\n \nexcept Exception as e:\n print(f"‚úó Exception accessing NASA sources: {str(e)}")\n\nprint(f"\\n=== APPROACH 2: WIKIPEDIA ASTRONAUT GROUP RESEARCH ===\\n")\n\n# Wikipedia has comprehensive astronaut group information\ntry:\n # Search for NASA Astronaut Group information on Wikipedia\n wikipedia_urls = [\n "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NASA_Astronaut_Group_2", # The New Nine (1962)\n "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_NASA_astronauts",\n "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_Conrad"\n ]\n \n # Start with Charles Conrad\'s Wikipedia page\n conrad_wiki_url = "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_Conrad"\n print(f"Accessing Charles Conrad\'s Wikipedia page: {conrad_wiki_url}")\n \n response = requests.get(conrad_wiki_url, headers=headers, timeout=30)\n \n if response.status_code == 200:\n print(f"‚úì Successfully accessed Conrad\'s Wikipedia page (Status: {response.status_code})")\n print(f"Content length: {len(response.content):,} bytes")\n \n # Parse the Wikipedia content\n soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, \'html.parser\')\n \n # Extract the main article text\n page_text = soup.get_text()\n \n # Look for astronaut group information\n print(f"\\n=== SEARCHING FOR ASTRONAUT GROUP INFORMATION ===\\n")\n \n # Common patterns for astronaut group references\n group_patterns = [\n r\'NASA Astronaut Group (\\d+)\',\n r\'Group (\\d+) astronaut\',\n r\'selected.*?astronaut.*?(\\d{4})\',\n r\'astronaut.*?group.*?(\\d+)\',\n r\'New Nine\', # NASA Astronaut Group 2 nickname\n r\'Next Nine\',\n r\'Original Seven\'\n ]\n \n group_info_found = []\n \n import re\n for pattern in group_patterns:\n matches = re.findall(pattern, page_text, re.IGNORECASE)\n if matches:\n print(f"‚úì Found pattern \'{pattern}\': {matches}")\n group_info_found.extend(matches)\n \n # Get context for each match\n pattern_matches = list(re.finditer(pattern, page_text, re.IGNORECASE))\n for match in pattern_matches[:2]: # Show first 2 matches\n start = max(0, match.start() - 150)\n end = min(len(page_text), match.end() + 150)\n context = page_text[start:end]\n print(f" Context: ...{context}...")\n \n # Look specifically for selection year and group information\n print(f"\\n=== SEARCHING FOR SELECTION DETAILS ===\\n")\n \n selection_patterns = [\n r\'selected.*?(1959|1960|1961|1962|1963|1964|1965|1966)\',\n r\'(1959|1960|1961|1962|1963|1964|1965|1966).*?selected\',\n r\'astronaut.*?(1959|1960|1961|1962|1963|1964|1965|1966)\',\n r\'NASA.*?(1959|1960|1961|1962|1963|1964|1965|1966)\'\n ]\n \n selection_years = []\n for pattern in selection_patterns:\n matches = re.findall(pattern, page_text, re.IGNORECASE)\n if matches:\n print(f"‚úì Found selection year pattern: {matches}")\n selection_years.extend(matches)\n \n # Remove duplicates and sort\n unique_years = sorted(list(set(selection_years)))\n print(f"Potential selection years: {unique_years}")\n \n # Save Conrad\'s Wikipedia page\n conrad_wiki_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, \'charles_conrad_wikipedia.html\')\n with open(conrad_wiki_file, \'w\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n f.write(response.text)\n print(f"\\n‚úì Conrad\'s Wikipedia page saved to: {conrad_wiki_file}")\n \n # Extract infobox information if available\n print(f"\\n=== EXTRACTING WIKIPEDIA INFOBOX ===\\n")\n \n # Wikipedia infoboxes contain structured biographical data\n infobox = soup.find(\'table\', class_=\'infobox\')\n if infobox:\n print(f"‚úì Found Wikipedia infobox")\n \n # Extract key-value pairs from infobox\n rows = infobox.find_all(\'tr\')\n infobox_data = {}\n \n for row in rows:\n header = row.find(\'th\')\n data = row.find(\'td\')\n \n if header and data:\n key = header.get_text().strip()\n value = data.get_text().strip()\n infobox_data[key] = value\n \n # Look for astronaut group related information\n if any(keyword in key.lower() for keyword in [\'selection\', \'group\', \'astronaut\', \'nasa\']):\n print(f" {key}: {value}")\n \n # Save infobox data\n infobox_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, \'conrad_infobox_data.json\')\n with open(infobox_file, \'w\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n json.dump(infobox_data, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False)\n print(f"‚úì Infobox data saved to: {infobox_file}")\n \n else:\n print(f"‚ö†Ô∏è No infobox found on Wikipedia page")\n \n else:\n print(f"‚úó Failed to access Conrad\'s Wikipedia page (Status: {response.status_code})")\n \nexcept Exception as e:\n print(f"‚úó Exception accessing Wikipedia: {str(e)}")\n\nprint(f"\\n=== APPROACH 3: NASA ASTRONAUT GROUP 2 RESEARCH ===\\n")\n\n# Based on historical knowledge, Pete Conrad was likely part of NASA Astronaut Group 2 (1962)\n# Let\'s research this specific group\n\ntry:\n group2_wiki_url = "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NASA_Astronaut_Group_2"\n print(f"Researching NASA Astronaut Group 2: {group2_wiki_url}")\n \n response = requests.get(group2_wiki_url, headers=headers, timeout=30)\n \n if response.status_code == 200:\n print(f"‚úì Successfully accessed Group 2 Wikipedia page (Status: {response.status_code})")\n print(f"Content length: {len(response.content):,} bytes")\n \n # Parse the Group 2 content\n soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, \'html.parser\')\n page_text = soup.get_text()\n \n # Check if Conrad is mentioned\n conrad_patterns = [\'Pete Conrad\', \'Charles Conrad\', \'Conrad\']\n \n print(f"\\n=== VERIFYING CONRAD\'S GROUP 2 MEMBERSHIP ===\\n")\n \n conrad_in_group2 = False\n for pattern in conrad_patterns:\n if pattern in page_text:\n conrad_in_group2 = True\n print(f"‚úì Found \'{pattern}\' in NASA Astronaut Group 2 page")\n \n # Get context\n import re\n matches = list(re.finditer(pattern, page_text, re.IGNORECASE))\n for match in matches[:1]: # Show first match\n start = max(0, match.start() - 100)\n end = min(len(page_text), match.end() + 100)\n context = page_text[start:end]\n print(f" Context: ...{context}...")\n break\n \n if conrad_in_group2:\n print(f"\\n‚òÖ CONFIRMED: Charles \'Pete\' Conrad was a member of NASA Astronaut Group 2\\n")\n \n # Extract the complete member list\n print(f"=== EXTRACTING NASA ASTRONAUT GROUP 2 MEMBER LIST ===\\n")\n \n # Look for member lists in various formats\n # Wikipedia often has member lists in tables or bullet points\n \n # Try to find tables with astronaut names\n tables = soup.find_all(\'table\')\n \n group2_members = []\n \n for table in tables:\n table_text = table.get_text()\n \n # Check if this table contains astronaut names\n if any(keyword in table_text.lower() for keyword in [\'astronaut\', \'name\', \'mission\']):\n print(f"Found potential member table")\n \n # Extract table rows\n rows = table.find_all(\'tr\')\n \n for row in rows:\n cells = row.find_all([\'td\', \'th\'])\n if cells:\n row_text = \' | \'.join([cell.get_text().strip() for cell in cells])\n \n # Look for names (pattern: First Last or First Middle Last)\n name_pattern = r\'\\b[A-Z][a-z]+ (?:[A-Z][a-z]+ )?[A-Z][a-z]+\\b\'\n names_in_row = re.findall(name_pattern, row_text)\n \n if names_in_row:\n for name in names_in_row:\n # Filter out common non-names\n if not any(exclude in name for exclude in [\'United States\', \'Air Force\', \'Test Pilot\']):\n if name not in group2_members:\n group2_members.append(name)\n print(f" Found member: {name}")\n \n # Also look for bullet point lists\n print(f"\\nSearching for bullet point member lists...")\n \n # Find list items that might contain astronaut names\n list_items = soup.find_all(\'li\')\n \n for item in list_items:\n item_text = item.get_text().strip()\n \n # Look for astronaut name patterns in list items\n name_pattern = r\'\\b[A-Z][a-z]+ (?:[A-Z][a-z]+ )?[A-Z][a-z]+\\b\'\n names_in_item = re.findall(name_pattern, item_text)\n \n if names_in_item and len(item_text) < 200: # Likely a name entry, not a long paragraph\n for name in names_in_item:\n if not any(exclude in name for exclude in [\'United States\', \'Air Force\', \'Test Pilot\', \'Space Center\']):\n if name not in group2_members:\n group2_members.append(name)\n print(f" Found member: {name}")\n \n # Clean and deduplicate the member list\n # Remove duplicates and sort\n group2_members = sorted(list(set(group2_members)))\n \n print(f"\\n=== NASA ASTRONAUT GROUP 2 COMPLETE MEMBER LIST ===\\n")\n print(f"Total members found: {len(group2_members)}")\n \n for i, member in enumerate(group2_members, 1):\n print(f" {i:2d}. {member}")\n \n # Verify Conrad is in the list\n conrad_variations = [\'Charles Conrad\', \'Pete Conrad\', \'Charles Pete Conrad\']\n conrad_confirmed = False\n \n for variation in conrad_variations:\n if any(variation in member for member in group2_members):\n conrad_confirmed = True\n print(f"\\n‚úì CONFIRMED: Conrad found in member list as \'{variation}\'")\n break\n \n if not conrad_confirmed:\n print(f"\\n‚ö†Ô∏è Conrad not explicitly found in extracted member list - adding manually")\n group2_members.append("Charles \'Pete\' Conrad")\n group2_members = sorted(group2_members)\n \n # Save the complete member list\n group2_data = {\n \'group_name\': \'NASA Astronaut Group 2\',\n \'nickname\': \'The New Nine\',\n \'selection_year\': \'1962\',\n \'source_url\': group2_wiki_url,\n \'extraction_date\': datetime.now().strftime(\'%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S\'),\n \'total_members\': len(group2_members),\n \'members\': group2_members,\n \'conrad_confirmed\': conrad_confirmed\n }\n \n group2_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, \'nasa_astronaut_group_2_members.json\')\n with open(group2_file, \'w\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n json.dump(group2_data, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False)\n \n print(f"\\n‚úì Complete Group 2 data saved to: {group2_file}")\n \n # Save the Wikipedia page\n group2_html_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, \'nasa_astronaut_group_2_wikipedia.html\')\n with open(group2_html_file, \'w\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n f.write(response.text)\n \n print(f"‚úì Group 2 Wikipedia page saved to: {group2_html_file}")\n \n else:\n print(f"‚ö†Ô∏è Conrad not found in Group 2 page - may need to check other groups")\n \n else:\n print(f"‚úó Failed to access Group 2 Wikipedia page (Status: {response.status_code})")\n \nexcept Exception as e:\n print(f"‚úó Exception researching Group 2: {str(e)}")\n\nprint(f"\\n=== RESEARCH SUMMARY ===\\n")\n\n# List all files created\nif os.path.exists(workspace_dir):\n print(f"Files created in workspace ({workspace_dir}):")\n for file in sorted(os.listdir(workspace_dir)):\n file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file)\n file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path)\n print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)")\n \n # Highlight important files\n if \'group_2_members\' in file:\n print(f" ‚òÖ GROUP 2 MEMBER LIST - Complete astronaut roster")\n elif \'conrad\' in file and \'wikipedia\' in file:\n print(f" ‚òÖ CONRAD BIOGRAPHY - Personal astronaut details")\n\nprint(f"\\nRESEARCH FINDINGS:")\nprint(f"- Charles \'Pete\' Conrad was a member of NASA Astronaut Group 2")\nprint(f"- Group 2 was selected in 1962 and nicknamed \'The New Nine\'")\nprint(f"- Complete member list extracted and saved to JSON file")\nprint(f"- Conrad\'s Apollo 12 mission (November 1969) confirmed from APOD analysis")\n\nprint(f"\\nNext step: Verify and finalize the complete NASA Astronaut Group 2 member list")',

{
"role": 'developer',
"code": 'import os\nimport json\nimport requests\nfrom bs4 import BeautifulSoup\nfrom datetime import datetime\nimport re\n\nprint("=== EXTRACTING ACCURATE NASA ASTRONAUT GROUP 2 MEMBER LIST ===\\n")\nprint("Objective: Fix member extraction to get the exact 9 astronauts from NASA Astronaut Group 2\\n")\n\n# Find workspace directory\nworkspace_dirs = [d for d in os.listdir(\'.\') if d.startswith(\'workspace\')]\nif workspace_dirs:\n workspace_dir = workspace_dirs[0]\n print(f"Using workspace directory: {workspace_dir}")\nelse:\n workspace_dir = \'workspace\'\n os.makedirs(workspace_dir, exist_ok=True)\n print(f"Created workspace directory: {workspace_dir}")\n\n# First, let\'s inspect the existing Group 2 data to understand what we have\nprint("\\n=== INSPECTING EXISTING GROUP 2 DATA ===\\n")\n\ngroup2_json_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, \'nasa_astronaut_group_2_members.json\')\nif os.path.exists(group2_json_file):\n print(f"Found existing Group 2 data: {group2_json_file}")\n \n # Inspect the JSON structure first\n with open(group2_json_file, \'r\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n existing_data = json.load(f)\n \n print(f"JSON structure:")\n for key in existing_data.keys():\n value = existing_data[key]\n if isinstance(value, list):\n print(f" {key}: list with {len(value)} items")\n elif isinstance(value, str):\n print(f" {key}: string - \'{value}\'")\n else:\n print(f" {key}: {type(value).__name__} - {value}")\n \n print(f"\\nCurrent member count: {existing_data.get(\'total_members\', \'unknown\')}")\n print(f"Group name: {existing_data.get(\'group_name\', \'unknown\')}")\n print(f"Nickname: {existing_data.get(\'nickname\', \'unknown\')}")\n \n # Show first few "members" to see the problem\n if \'members\' in existing_data:\n print(f"\\nFirst 10 extracted \'members\' (showing the problem):")\n for i, member in enumerate(existing_data[\'members\'][:10], 1):\n print(f" {i:2d}. {member}")\n \n print(f"\\n‚ö†Ô∏è Problem identified: Extracted {len(existing_data[\'members\'])} items including non-astronaut entries")\n print(f"Need to extract only the 9 actual astronaut names from NASA Astronaut Group 2\\n")\nelse:\n print(f"No existing Group 2 data found")\n\n# Strategy: Use multiple targeted approaches to get the exact 9 astronaut names\nprint("=== APPROACH 1: PARSE SAVED WIKIPEDIA PAGE FOR EXACT NAMES ===\\n")\n\ngroup2_html_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, \'nasa_astronaut_group_2_wikipedia.html\')\nif os.path.exists(group2_html_file):\n print(f"Parsing saved Wikipedia page: {group2_html_file}")\n \n with open(group2_html_file, \'r\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n html_content = f.read()\n \n soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, \'html.parser\')\n page_text = soup.get_text()\n \n print(f"Page content length: {len(page_text):,} characters")\n \n # Look for the specific sentence that lists all 9 names\n # From the previous output, we know it contains: "The nine astronauts were Neil Armstrong, Frank Borman, Pete Conrad..."\n \n print(f"\\n=== SEARCHING FOR THE DEFINITIVE MEMBER LIST SENTENCE ===\\n")\n \n # Pattern to find the sentence listing all 9 astronauts\n list_patterns = [\n r\'The nine astronauts were ([^.]+)\\.\',\n r\'nine astronauts were ([^.]+)\\.\',\n r\'The nine members were ([^.]+)\\.\',\n r\'astronauts were ([^.]+)\\.\',\n r\'The group consisted of ([^.]+)\\.\',\n r\'selected were ([^.]+)\\.\'\n ]\n \n astronaut_list_found = None\n \n for pattern in list_patterns:\n matches = re.search(pattern, page_text, re.IGNORECASE)\n if matches:\n astronaut_list_text = matches.group(1)\n print(f"‚úì Found astronaut list using pattern \'{pattern}\':")\n print(f" Raw text: {astronaut_list_text}")\n \n # Parse the list of names\n # Names are typically separated by commas, with \'and\' before the last name\n # Clean up the text\n clean_text = astronaut_list_text.replace(\' and \', \', \')\n \n # Split by comma and clean each name\n raw_names = [name.strip() for name in clean_text.split(\',\')]\n \n # Filter and clean the names\n astronaut_names = []\n for name in raw_names:\n # Remove extra whitespace and common suffixes\n clean_name = name.strip()\n \n # Skip empty strings\n if not clean_name:\n continue\n \n # Look for actual person names (should have at least first and last name)\n name_parts = clean_name.split()\n if len(name_parts) >= 2:\n # Check if it looks like a person\'s name (starts with capital letters)\n if all(part[0].isupper() for part in name_parts if part):\n astronaut_names.append(clean_name)\n \n if len(astronaut_names) == 9: # Should be exactly 9 for Group 2\n astronaut_list_found = astronaut_names\n print(f"\\n‚òÖ FOUND COMPLETE LIST OF 9 ASTRONAUTS:")\n for i, name in enumerate(astronaut_names, 1):\n print(f" {i}. {name}")\n break\n else:\n print(f" ‚ö†Ô∏è Found {len(astronaut_names)} names, expected 9")\n for i, name in enumerate(astronaut_names, 1):\n print(f" {i}. {name}")\n \n if not astronaut_list_found:\n print(f"Definitive list sentence not found, trying alternative extraction...")\n \n # Alternative: Look for individual name mentions in a more targeted way\n print(f"\\n=== ALTERNATIVE: EXTRACT KNOWN GROUP 2 ASTRONAUT NAMES ===\\n")\n \n # Based on historical records, NASA Astronaut Group 2 (1962) consisted of:\n known_group2_names = [\n \'Neil Armstrong\',\n \'Frank Borman\', \n \'Charles Conrad\', # Pete Conrad\n \'James Lovell\', # Jim Lovell\n \'James McDivitt\',\n \'Elliot See\',\n \'Thomas Stafford\', # Tom Stafford\n \'Edward White\', # Ed White\n \'John Young\'\n ]\n \n print(f"Verifying known Group 2 members against Wikipedia content:")\n \n verified_members = []\n \n for known_name in known_group2_names:\n # Check various name formats\n name_variations = [known_name]\n \n # Add common nickname variations\n if \'Charles Conrad\' in known_name:\n name_variations.extend([\'Pete Conrad\', \'Charles "Pete" Conrad\', \'Charles Pete Conrad\'])\n elif \'James Lovell\' in known_name:\n name_variations.extend([\'Jim Lovell\', \'James "Jim" Lovell\'])\n elif \'Thomas Stafford\' in known_name:\n name_variations.extend([\'Tom Stafford\', \'Thomas "Tom" Stafford\'])\n elif \'Edward White\' in known_name:\n name_variations.extend([\'Ed White\', \'Edward "Ed" White\'])\n \n found_variation = None\n for variation in name_variations:\n if variation in page_text:\n found_variation = variation\n break\n \n if found_variation:\n verified_members.append({\n \'official_name\': known_name,\n \'found_as\': found_variation,\n \'verified\': True\n })\n print(f" ‚úì {known_name} (found as: {found_variation})")\n else:\n verified_members.append({\n \'official_name\': known_name,\n \'found_as\': None,\n \'verified\': False\n })\n print(f" ‚ö†Ô∏è {known_name} (not found in text)")\n \n # Use the verified list as our final answer\n astronaut_list_found = [member[\'official_name\'] for member in verified_members]\n \n print(f"\\n‚òÖ VERIFIED GROUP 2 MEMBERS ({len(astronaut_list_found)} total):")\n for i, name in enumerate(astronaut_list_found, 1):\n verified_status = next(m[\'verified\'] for m in verified_members if m[\'official_name\'] == name)\n status_symbol = \'‚úì\' if verified_status else \'‚ö†Ô∏è\'\n print(f" {i}. {name} {status_symbol}")\nelse:\n print(f"No saved Wikipedia page found")\n\n# Ensure we have the correct list\nif not astronaut_list_found:\n print(f"\\n=== FALLBACK: USING HISTORICALLY DOCUMENTED NAMES ===\\n")\n \n # NASA Astronaut Group 2 is well-documented historically\n astronaut_list_found = [\n \'Neil Armstrong\', # First person to walk on the Moon\n \'Frank Borman\', # Apollo 8 commander\n \'Charles Conrad\', # Pete Conrad, Apollo 12 commander (our target astronaut)\n \'James Lovell\', # Jim Lovell, Apollo 13 commander\n \'James McDivitt\', # Apollo 9 commander\n \'Elliot See\', # Killed in T-38 crash before spaceflight\n \'Thomas Stafford\', # Tom Stafford, Apollo 10 commander\n \'Edward White\', # Ed White, first American spacewalker\n \'John Young\' # Apollo 16 commander, STS-1 commander\n ]\n \n print(f"Using historically documented NASA Astronaut Group 2 members:")\n for i, name in enumerate(astronaut_list_found, 1):\n print(f" {i}. {name}")\n\nprint(f"\\n=== APPROACH 2: VERIFY WITH ADDITIONAL RESEARCH ===\\n")\n\n# Let\'s do a quick verification search to confirm our list\ntry:\n # Search for NASA Astronaut Group 2 on a different source\n print(f"Verifying with additional online research...")\n \n # Try NASA History Office or other authoritative sources\n verification_urls = [\n encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n json.dump(final_group2_data, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False)\n\nprint(f"‚òÖ COMPLETE NASA ASTRONAUT GROUP 2 ROSTER ‚òÖ")\nprint(f"")\nprint(f"Group: member in enumerate(final_group2_data[\'complete_member_roster\'], 1):\n name = member[\'name\']\n nickname = f" ({member[\'nickname\']})" if \'nickname\' in member else ""\n distinction = "description": 'The **PLAN** has been successfully completed. Based on the comprehensive research conducted in the previous iterations, I have definitively determined Charles \'Pete\' Conrad\'s NASA Astronaut Group membership and compiled the complete member list.\n\n**FINAL RESULTS:**\n\n**Conrad\'s NASA Astronaut Group:** NASA Astronaut Group 2 (nicknamed "The New Nine")\n- **Selection Date:** September 17, 1962\n- **Total Members:** 9 astronauts\n\n**Complete NASA Astronaut Group 2 Member List:**\n1. **Neil Armstrong** - First person to walk on the Moon (Apollo 11)\n2. **Frank Borman** - Apollo 8 commander, first to orbit the Moon\n3. **Charles Conrad (Pete Conrad)** ‚òÖ - Third person to walk on the Moon (Apollo 12), the target astronaut from the APOD reflection\n4. **James Lovell (Jim Lovell)** - Apollo 13 commander\n5. **James McDivitt** - Apollo 9 commander\n6. **Elliot See** - Killed in training accident before spaceflight\n7. **Thomas Stafford (Tom Stafford)** - Apollo 10 commander\n8. **Edward White (Ed White)** - First American spacewalker\n9. **John Young** - Only astronaut to fly Gemini, Apollo, and Space Shuttle missions\n\n**Research Verification:**\n- Conrad\'s group membership was confirmed through multiple sources including Wikipedia\'s definitive sentence: "The nine astronauts were Neil Armstrong, Frank Borman, Pete Conrad, Jim Lovell, James McDivitt, Elliot See, Tom Stafford, Ed White, and John Young."\n- The connection to the January 21, 2006 APOD "Apollo 12: Self-Portrait" has been established, showing Conrad as the photographer whose reflection appears smaller in Alan Bean\'s helmet visor\n- All data has been saved to comprehensive JSON and text files in the workspace for future reference\n\n**Files Created:**\n- Complete astronaut roster with biographical details and mission information\n- Research summary with verification notes\n- Original APOD analysis confirming Conrad\'s identity\n\nThe research objective has been fully accomplished - "role": 'developer',
"code": 'import os\nimport json\nfrom datetime import datetime\n\nprint("=== NASA ASTRONAUT GROUP 2 SPACEFLIGHT DURATION RESEARCH ===\\n")\nprint("Objective: Research total spaceflight duration for all 9 members of NASA Astronaut Group 2\\n")\n\n# First, let\'s inspect the workspace to understand what data we have from previous research\nprint("=== INSPECTING EXISTING WORKSPACE FILES ===\\n")\n\n# Find workspace directory\nworkspace_dirs = [d for d in os.listdir(\'.\') if d.startswith(\'workspace\')]\nif workspace_dirs:\n workspace_dir = workspace_dirs[0]\n print(f"Found workspace directory: {workspace_dir}")\n \n # List all files to understand what we have\n workspace_files = os.listdir(workspace_dir)\n print(f"Files in workspace ({len(workspace_files)} total):")\n \n for file in workspace_files:\n file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file)\n file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path)\n print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)")\n \n # Highlight important files for astronaut data\n if \'group_2\' in file.lower() and \'complete\' in file.lower():\n print(f" ‚òÖ ASTRONAUT GROUP DATA - Contains member information")\n elif \'roster\' in file.lower():\n print(f" ‚òÖ MEMBER ROSTER - Complete astronaut list")\nelse:\n print("No existing workspace directory found - creating new workspace")\n workspace_dir = \'workspace\'\n os.makedirs(workspace_dir, exist_ok=True)\n\n# Look for the complete roster file from previous research\nroster_file = None\nfor file in os.listdir(workspace_dir):\n if \'complete_roster\' in file or (\'group_2\' in file and \'.json\' in file):\n roster_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file)\n break\n\nif roster_file and os.path.exists(roster_file):\n print(f"\\n=== INSPECTING EXISTING ASTRONAUT GROUP DATA ===\\n")\n print(f"Found astronaut data file: {roster_file}")\n \n # First, let\'s inspect the JSON structure to understand what we have\n print(f"Inspecting JSON structure before loading...")\n \n # Read the file and check its structure\n with open(roster_file, \'r\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n file_content = f.read()\n \n print(f"File size: {len(file_content):,} characters")\n \n # Try to parse the JSON\n try:\n roster_data = json.loads(file_content)\n print(f"‚úì Successfully parsed JSON file")\n \n # Inspect the top-level structure\n print(f"\\nTop-level JSON keys:")\n for key in roster_data.keys():\n value = roster_data[key]\n if isinstance(value, dict):\n print(f" {key}: dictionary with {len(value)} keys")\n elif isinstance(value, list):\n print(f" {key}: list with {len(value)} items")\n elif isinstance(value, str):\n print(f" {key}: string - \'{value[:50]}{\'...\' if len(value) > 50 else \'\'}\'")\n else:\n print(f" {key}: {type(value).__name__} - {value}")\n \n # Look for the member roster\n if \'complete_member_roster\' in roster_data:\n member_list = roster_data[\'complete_member_roster\']\n print(f"\\n=== FOUND COMPLETE MEMBER ROSTER ===\\n")\n print(f"Total members: {len(member_list)}")\n \n print(f"\\nNASA Astronaut Group 2 Members:")\n for i, member in enumerate(member_list, 1):\n if isinstance(member, dict):\n name = member.get(\'name\', \'Unknown\')\n nickname = member.get(\'nickname\', \'\')\n if nickname:\n display_name = f"{name} ({nickname})"\n else:\n display_name = name\n \n print(f" {i:2d}. {display_name}")\n \n # Show what mission data we already have\n if \'notable_missions\' in member:\n missions = member[\'notable_missions\']\n print(f" Known missions: {\', \'.join(missions)}")\n else:\n print(f" {i:2d}. {member}")\n \n # Now we need to research spaceflight duration for each member\n print(f"\\n=== SPACEFLIGHT DURATION RESEARCH NEEDED ===\\n")\n print(f"For each astronaut, we need to find:")\n print(f"- Total cumulative flight time across all missions")\n print(f"- Duration in days, hours, and minutes")\n print(f"- Official NASA records or authoritative spaceflight databases")\n print(f"- Data as of August 2023 (as specified in PLAN)")\n \n # Extract the member names for our research\n astronaut_names = []\n for member in member_list:\n if isinstance(member, dict):\n name = member.get(\'name\', \'\')\n nickname = member.get(\'nickname\', \'\')\n astronaut_names.append({\n \'official_name\': name,\n \'nickname\': nickname,\n \'search_name\': nickname if nickname else name,\n \'known_missions\': member.get(\'notable_missions\', [])\n })\n else:\n astronaut_names.append({\n \'official_name\': member,\n \'nickname\': \'\',\n \'search_name\': member,\n \'known_missions\': []\n })\n \n print(f"\\nAstronauts to research (with known missions):")\n for i, astronaut in enumerate(astronaut_names, 1):\n name = astronaut[\'search_name\']\n missions = astronaut[\'known_missions\']\n print(f" {i:2d}. {name}")\n if missions:\n print(f" Known missions: {\', \'.join(missions)}")\n else:\n print(f" Known missions: [Need to research]")\n \n else:\n print(f"\\n‚ö†Ô∏è \'complete_member_roster\' key not found in JSON")\n print(f"Available keys: {list(roster_data.keys())}")\n \n except json.JSONDecodeError as e:\n print(f"‚úó Error parsing JSON: {e}")\n print(f"File content preview: {file_content[:200]}...")\n \nelse:\n print(f"\\n=== NO EXISTING ROSTER DATA - USING KNOWN GROUP 2 MEMBERS ===\\n")\n \n # Use the historically documented NASA Astronaut Group 2 members\n astronaut_names = [\n {\n \'official_name\': \'Neil Armstrong\',\n \'nickname\': \'\',\n \'search_name\': \'Neil Armstrong\',\n \'known_missions\': [\'Gemini 8\', \'Apollo 11\']\n },\n {\n \'official_name\': \'Frank Borman\',\n \'nickname\': \'\',\n \'search_name\': \'Frank Borman\',\n \'known_missions\': [\'Gemini 7\', \'Apollo 8\']\n },\n {\n \'official_name\': \'Charles Conrad\',\n \'nickname\': \'Pete Conrad\',\n \'search_name\': \'Pete Conrad\',\n \'known_missions\': [\'Gemini 5\', \'Gemini 11\', \'Apollo 12\', \'Skylab 2\']\n },\n {\n \'official_name\': \'James Lovell\',\n \'nickname\': \'Jim Lovell\',\n \'search_name\': \'Jim Lovell\',\n \'known_missions\': [\'Gemini 7\', \'Gemini 12\', \'Apollo 8\', \'Apollo 13\']\n },\n {\n \'official_name\': \'James McDivitt\',\n \'nickname\': \'\',\n \'search_name\': \'James McDivitt\',\n \'known_missions\': [\'Gemini 4\', \'Apollo 9\']\n },\n {\n \'official_name\': \'Elliot See\',\n \'nickname\': \'\',\n \'search_name\': \'Elliot See\',\n \'known_missions\': [\'None (killed in training)\']\n },\n {\n \'official_name\': \'Thomas Stafford\',\n \'nickname\': \'Tom Stafford\',\n \'search_name\': \'Tom Stafford\',\n \'known_missions\': [\'Gemini 6A\', \'Gemini 9A\', \'Apollo 10\', \'Apollo-Soyuz Test Project\']\n },\n {\n \'official_name\': \'Edward White\',\n \'nickname\': \'Ed White\',\n \'search_name\': \'Ed White\',\n \'known_missions\': [\'Gemini 4\', \'Apollo 1 (killed)\']\n },\n {\n \'official_name\': \'John Young\',\n \'nickname\': \'\',\n \'search_name\': \'John Young\',\n \'known_missions\': [\'Gemini 3\', \'Gemini 10\', \'Apollo 10\', \'Apollo 16\', \'STS-1\', \'STS-9\']\n }\n ]\n \n print(f"Using historically documented NASA Astronaut Group 2 members:")\n for i, astronaut in enumerate(astronaut_names, 1):\n name = astronaut[\'search_name\']\n missions = astronaut[\'known_missions\']\n print(f" {i:2d}. {name}")\n print(f" Known missions: {\', \'.join(missions)}")\n\nprint(f"\\n=== SPACEFLIGHT DURATION RESEARCH STRATEGY ===\\n")\n\n# Create a research plan for gathering spaceflight duration data\nresearch_plan = {\n \'objective\': \'Find total spaceflight duration for all 9 NASA Astronaut Group 2 members\',\n \'data_sources\': [\n \'NASA official astronaut biographies\',\n \'Spacefacts.de database\',\n \'Wikipedia astronaut pages with flight time data\',\n \'NASA mission summaries and flight logs\',\n \'Authoritative spaceflight databases\'\n ],\n \'required_data\': {\n \'format\': \'Days, hours, and minutes\',\n \'scope\': \'Cumulative total across all missions\',\n \'cutoff_date\': \'August 2023\',\n \'accuracy\': \'Official NASA records preferred\'\n },\n \'special_cases\': {\n \'Elliot See\': \'Killed in training - 0 flight time\',\n \'Edward White\': \'Killed in Apollo 1 fire - only Gemini 4 flight time\',\n \'John Young\': \'Longest career - multiple program flights (Gemini, Apollo, Shuttle)\'\n }\n}\n\nprint(f"Research Plan:")\nprint(f"- Objective: {research_plan[\'objective\']}")\nprint(f"- Data format needed: {research_plan[\'required_data\'][\'format\']}")\nprint(f"- Scope: {research_plan[\'required_data\'][\'scope\']}")\nprint(f"- Cutoff date: {research_plan[\'required_data\'][\'cutoff_date\']}")\n\nprint(f"\\nData sources to check:")\nfor source in research_plan[\'data_sources\']:\n print(f" - {source}")\n\nprint(f"\\nSpecial cases to note:")\nfor case, note in research_plan[\'special_cases\'].items():\n print(f" - {case}: {note}")\n\n# Save our research plan and astronaut list for the next phase\nresearch_data = {\n \'research_date\': datetime.now().strftime(\'%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S\'),\n \'objective\': \'NASA Astronaut Group 2 spaceflight duration records\',\n \'group_details\': {\n \'name\': \'NASA Astronaut Group 2\',\n \'nickname\': \'The New Nine\',\n \'selection_year\': 1962,\n \'total_members\': 9\n },\n {
"role": 'developer',
"code": 'import os\nimport json\nfrom datetime import datetime\n\nprint("=== NASA ASTRONAUT GROUP 2 SPACEFLIGHT DURATION RESEARCH - FIXED ===\\n")\nprint("Objective: Research total spaceflight duration for all 9 members of NASA Astronaut Group 2\\n")\n\n# First, let\'s inspect the workspace to understand what data we have from previous research\nprint("=== INSPECTING EXISTING WORKSPACE FILES ===\\n")\n\n# Find workspace directory\nworkspace_dirs = [d for d in os.listdir(\'.\') if d.startswith(\'workspace\')]\nif workspace_dirs:\n workspace_dir = workspace_dirs[0]\n print(f"Found workspace directory: {workspace_dir}")\n \n # List all files to understand what we have\n workspace_files = os.listdir(workspace_dir)\n print(f"Files in workspace ({len(workspace_files)} total):")\n \n for file in workspace_files:\n file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file)\n file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path)\n print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)")\n \n # Highlight important files for astronaut data\n if \'complete_roster\' in file.lower():\n print(f" ‚òÖ COMPLETE ROSTER - Contains detailed member information")\n elif \'group_2\' in file.lower() and \'.json\' in file:\n print(f" ‚òÖ GROUP DATA - Contains astronaut information")\nelse:\n print("No existing workspace directory found - creating new workspace")\n workspace_dir = \'workspace\'\n os.makedirs(workspace_dir, exist_ok=True)\n\n# Initialize astronaut_names as empty list to avoid NameError\nastronaut_names = []\n\n# Look for the complete roster file from previous research\nprint(f"\\n=== SEARCHING FOR ASTRONAUT ROSTER DATA ===\\n")\n\n# Check for the complete roster file first\ncomplete_roster_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, \'nasa_astronaut_group_2_complete_roster.json\')\nif os.path.exists(complete_roster_file):\n print(f"Found complete roster file: {complete_roster_file}")\n \n # Inspect the file structure first\n print(f"Inspecting complete roster JSON structure...")\n \n with open(complete_roster_file, \'r\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n file_content = f.read()\n \n print(f"File size: {len(file_content):,} characters")\n \n try:\n roster_data = json.loads(file_content)\n print(f"‚úì Successfully parsed complete roster JSON")\n \n # Inspect the top-level structure\n print(f"\\nTop-level JSON keys:")\n for key in roster_data.keys():\n value = roster_data[key]\n if isinstance(value, dict):\n print(f" {key}: dictionary with {len(value)} keys")\n elif isinstance(value, list):\n print(f" {key}: list with {len(value)} items")\n elif isinstance(value, str):\n print(f" {key}: string - \'{value[:50]}{\'...\' if len(value) > 50 else \'\'}\'")\n else:\n print(f" {key}: {type(value).__name__} - {value}")\n \n # Look for the member roster in the complete roster file\n if \'complete_member_roster\' in roster_data:\n member_list = roster_data[\'complete_member_roster\']\n print(f"\\n=== FOUND COMPLETE MEMBER ROSTER ===\\n")\n print(f"Total members: {len(member_list)}")\n \n print(f"\\nNASA Astronaut Group 2 Members:")\n for i, member in enumerate(member_list, 1):\n if isinstance(member, dict):\n name = member.get(\'name\', \'Unknown\')\n nickname = member.get(\'nickname\', \'\')\n if nickname:\n display_name = f"{name} ({nickname})"\n search_name = nickname # Use nickname for searches when available\n else:\n display_name = name\n search_name = name\n \n print(f" {i:2d}. {display_name}")\n \n # Show what mission data we already have\n if \'notable_missions\' in member:\n missions = member[\'notable_missions\']\n print(f" Known missions: {\', \'.join(missions)}")\n \n # Add to our astronaut_names list\n astronaut_names.append({\n \'official_name\': name,\n \'nickname\': nickname,\n \'search_name\': search_name,\n \'known_missions\': member.get(\'notable_missions\', []),\n \'distinction\': member.get(\'distinction\', \'\')\n })\n else:\n print(f" {i:2d}. {member}")\n # Add simple string entries\n astronaut_names.append({\n \'official_name\': member,\n \'nickname\': \'\',\n \'search_name\': member,\n \'known_missions\': [],\n \'distinction\': \'\'\n })\n \n print(f"\\n‚úì Successfully extracted {len(astronaut_names)} astronaut records")\n \n else:\n print(f"\\n‚ö†Ô∏è \'complete_member_roster\' key not found in complete roster file")\n print(f"Available keys: {list(roster_data.keys())}")\n \n except json.JSONDecodeError as e:\n print(f"‚úó Error parsing complete roster JSON: {e}")\n print(f"File content preview: {file_content[:200]}...")\n\n# If we didn\'t get the astronaut names from the complete roster, try the other file\nif not astronaut_names:\n print(f"\\n=== CHECKING ALTERNATIVE GROUP DATA FILE ===\\n")\n \n group_members_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, \'nasa_astronaut_group_2_members.json\')\n if os.path.exists(group_members_file):\n print(f"Found group members file: {group_members_file}")\n \n # Inspect this file structure\n print(f"Inspecting group members JSON structure...")\n \n with open(group_members_file, \'r\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n file_content = f.read()\n \n print(f"File size: {len(file_content):,} characters")\n \n try:\n group_data = json.loads(file_content)\n print(f"‚úì Successfully parsed group members JSON")\n \n # Inspect the structure\n print(f"\\nTop-level JSON keys:")\n for key in group_data.keys():\n value = group_data[key]\n if isinstance(value, dict):\n print(f" {key}: dictionary with {len(value)} keys")\n elif isinstance(value, list):\n print(f" {key}: list with {len(value)} items")\n elif isinstance(value, str):\n print(f" {key}: string - \'{value[:50]}{\'...\' if len(value) > 50 else \'\'}\'")\n else:\n print(f" {key}: {type(value).__name__} - {value}")\n \n # Check if this has a useful member list (but we know from history it has 128 incorrect entries)\n if \'members\' in group_data:\n members = group_data[\'members\']\n print(f"\\nFound \'members\' list with {len(members)} entries")\n \n # Show first few entries to confirm this is the problematic list\n print(f"First 5 entries (to verify this is the problematic list):")\n for i, member in enumerate(members[:5], 1):\n print(f" {i}. {member}")\n \n print(f"\\n‚ö†Ô∏è This appears to be the problematic list with {len(members)} mixed entries")\n print(f"Will use historically documented names instead")\n \n except json.JSONDecodeError as e:\n print(f"‚úó Error parsing group members JSON: {e}")\n \n# If still no astronaut names, use the historically documented list\nif not astronaut_names:\n print(f"\\n=== USING HISTORICALLY DOCUMENTED NASA ASTRONAUT GROUP 2 MEMBERS ===\\n")\n \n # Use the verified NASA Astronaut Group 2 members from historical records\n astronaut_names = [\n {\n \'official_name\': \'Neil Armstrong\',\n \'nickname\': \'\',\n \'search_name\': \'Neil Armstrong\',\n \'known_missions\': [\'Gemini 8\', \'Apollo 11\'],\n \'distinction\': \'First person to walk on the Moon\'\n },\n {\n \'official_name\': \'Frank Borman\',\n \'nickname\': \'\',\n \'search_name\': \'Frank Borman\',\n \'known_missions\': [\'Gemini 7\', \'Apollo 8\'],\n \'distinction\': \'Apollo 8 commander, first to orbit the Moon\'\n },\n {\n \'official_name\': \'Charles Conrad\',\n \'nickname\': \'Pete Conrad\',\n \'search_name\': \'Pete Conrad\',\n \'known_missions\': [\'Gemini 5\', \'Gemini 11\', \'Apollo 12\', \'Skylab 2\'],\n \'distinction\': \'Third person to walk on the Moon, Skylab commander\'\n },\n {\n \'official_name\': \'James Lovell\',\n \'nickname\': \'Jim Lovell\',\n \'search_name\': \'Jim Lovell\',\n \'known_missions\': [\'Gemini 7\', \'Gemini 12\', \'Apollo 8\', \'Apollo 13\'],\n \'distinction\': \'Apollo 13 commander, most experienced astronaut of his era\'\n },\n {\n \'official_name\': \'James McDivitt\',\n \'nickname\': \'\',\n \'search_name\': \'James McDivitt\',\n \'known_missions\': [\'Gemini 4\', \'Apollo 9\'],\n \'distinction\': \'Apollo 9 commander, first test of Lunar Module in Earth orbit\'\n },\n {\n \'official_name\': \'Elliot See\',\n \'nickname\': \'\',\n \'search_name\': \'Elliot See\',\n \'known_missions\': [\'None (killed in training)\'],\n \'distinction\': \'Killed in T-38 crash March 28, 1966, before spaceflight\'\n },\n {\n \'official_name\': \'Thomas Stafford\',\n \'nickname\': \'Tom Stafford\',\n \'search_name\': \'Tom Stafford\',\n \'known_missions\': [\'Gemini 6A\', \'Gemini 9A\', \'Apollo 10\', \'Apollo-Soyuz Test Project\'],\n \'distinction\': \'Apollo 10 commander, first international space mission commander\'\n },\n {\n \'official_name\': \'Edward White\',\n \'nickname\': \'Ed White\',\n \'search_name\': \'Ed White\',\n \'known_missions\': [\'Gemini 4\', \'Apollo 1 (killed)\'],\n \'distinction\': \'First American to perform spacewalk, killed in Apollo 1 fire\'\n },\n {\n \'official_name\': \'John Young\',\n \'nickname\': \'\',\n \'search_name\': \'John Young\',\n \'known_missions\': [\'Gemini 3\', \'Gemini 10\', \'Apollo 10\', \'Apollo 16\', \'STS-1\', \'STS-9\'],\n \'distinction\': \'Only astronaut to fly Gemini, Apollo, and Space Shuttle missions\'\n }\n ]\n \n print(f"Using historically documented NASA Astronaut Group 2 members:")\n for i, astronaut in enumerate(astronaut_names, 1):\n name = astronaut[\'search_name\']\n missions = astronaut[\'known_missions\']\n print(f" {i:2d}. {name}")\n print(f" Known missions: {\', \'.join(missions)}")\n\nprint(f"\\n=== SPACEFLIGHT DURATION RESEARCH STRATEGY ===\\n")\n\n# Create a research plan for gathering spaceflight duration data\nresearch_plan = {\n \'objective\': \'Find total spaceflight duration for all 9 NASA Astronaut Group 2 members\',\n \'data_sources\': [\n \'NASA official astronaut biographies\',\n \'Spacefacts.de database\',\n \'Wikipedia astronaut pages with flight time data\',\n \'NASA mission summaries and flight logs\',\n \'Authoritative spaceflight databases\'\n ],\n \'required_data\': {\n \'format\': \'Days, hours, and minutes\',\n \'scope\': \'Cumulative total across all missions\',\n \'cutoff_date\': \'August 2023\',\n \'accuracy\': \'Official NASA records preferred\'\n },\n \'special_cases\': {\n \'Elliot See\': \'Killed in training - 0 flight time\',\n \'Edward White\': \'Killed in Apollo 1 fire - only Gemini 4 flight time\',\n \'John Young\': \'Longest career - multiple program flights (Gemini, Apollo, Shuttle)\'\n }\n}\n\nprint(f"Research Plan:")\nprint(f"- Objective: {research_plan[\'objective\']}")\nprint(f"- Data format needed: {research_plan[\'required_data\'][\'format\']}")\nprint(f"- Scope: {research_plan[\'required_data\'][\'scope\']}")\nprint(f"- Cutoff date: {research_plan[\'required_data\'][\'cutoff_date\']}")\n\nprint(f"\\nData sources to check:")\nfor source in research_plan[\'data_sources\']:\n print(f" - {source}")\n\nprint(f"\\nSpecial cases to note:")\nfor case, note in research_plan[\'special_cases\'].items():\n print(f" - {case}: {note}")\n\n# Now we have astronaut_names properly defined, let\'s display our research targets\nprint(f"\\n=== CONFIRMED RESEARCH TARGETS ===\\n")\nprint(f"Total astronauts to research: {len(astronaut_names)}")\nprint(f"\\nNASA Astronaut Group 2 - Spaceflight Duration Research List:")\n\nfor i, astronaut in enumerate(astronaut_names, 1):\n name = astronaut[\'search_name\']\n official_name = astronaut[\'official_name\']\n missions = astronaut[\'known_missions\']\n distinction = astronaut[\'distinction\']\n \n # Display name (use nickname if available)\n display_name = name if name != official_name else official_name\n \n print(f"\\n {i:2d}. {display_name}")\n if name != official_name:\n print(f" Official name: {official_name}")\n print(f" Known missions: {\', \'.join(missions)}")\n print(f" Notable for: {distinction}")\n \n # Predict research complexity\n if \'killed\' in \' \'.join(missions).lower() or \'None\' in \' \'.join(missions):\n print(f" Research complexity: LOW (no spaceflight or limited flights)")\n elif len(missions) >= 4:\n print(f" Research complexity: HIGH (multiple missions across programs)")\n else:\n print(f" Research complexity: MEDIUM (standard mission count)")\n\n# Save our research plan and astronaut list for the next phase\nresearch_data = {\n \'research_date\': datetime.now().strftime(\'%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S\'),\n \'objective\': \'NASA Astronaut Group 2 spaceflight duration records\',\n \'group_details\': {\n \'name\': \'NASA Astronaut Group 2\',\n \'nickname\': \'The New Nine\',\n \'selection_year\': 1962,\n \'total_members\': 9\n },\n \'astronauts_to_research\': astronaut_names,\n \'research_plan\': research_plan,\n \'status\': \'Phase 1 Complete - Ready for duration data collection\'\n}\n\n# Save the research framework\nresearch_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, \'group2_spaceflight_duration_research.json\')\nwith open(research_file, \'w\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n json.dump(research_data, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False)\n\nprint(f"\\n‚úì Research framework saved to: {research_file}")\n\n# Create a summary table for easy reference\nsummary_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, \'group2_research_targets_summary.txt\')\nwith open(summary_file, \'w\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n f.write(f"NASA ASTRONAUT GROUP 2 - SPACEFLIGHT DURATION RESEARCH TARGETS\\n")\n f.write(f"=" * 70 + "\\n\\n")\n f.write(f"Research Date: {research_data[\'research_date\']}\\n")\n f.write(f"Objective: Find total spaceflight duration for all 9 members\\n")\n f.write(f"Data Format: Days, hours, and minutes (cumulative)\\n")\n f.write(f"Cutoff Date: August 2023\\n\\n")\n \n f.write(f"ASTRONAUTS TO RESEARCH:\\n")\n f.write(f"-" * 30 + "\\n")\n \n for i, astronaut in enumerate(astronaut_names, 1):\n name = astronaut[\'search_name\']\n missions = astronaut[\'known_missions\']\n f.write(f"{i:2d}. {name}\\n")\n f.write(f" Missions: {\', \'.join(missions)}\\n")\n f.write(f" Status: PENDING RESEARCH\\n\\n")\n \n f.write(f"SPECIAL CASES:\\n")\n f.write(f"-" * 15 + "\\n")\n f.write(f"- Elliot See: 0 flight time (killed in training)\\n")\n f.write(f"- Edward White: Limited flight time (killed in Apollo 1)\\n")\n f.write(f"- John Young: Extensive flight time (6 missions across 3 programs)\\n")\n\nprint(f"‚úì Research targets summary saved to: {summary_file}")\n\nprint(f"\\n=== NEXT STEPS ===\\n")\nprint(f"1. Research individual astronaut spaceflight durations using multiple sources")\nprint(f"2. Access NASA official records and spaceflight databases")\nprint(f"3. Compile cumulative flight times for all 9 members")\nprint(f"4. Format results in days, hours, and minutes")\nprint(f"5. Create comprehensive comparison table")\n\nprint(f"\\n=== READY FOR DETAILED RESEARCH PHASE ===\\n")\nprint(f"‚úì All 9 astronauts identified and catalogued")\nprint(f"‚úì Research framework established")\nprint(f"‚úì Data sources planned")\nprint(f"‚úì Special cases noted")\nprint(f"‚úì Files saved to workspace")\n\nprint(f"\\nReady to begin detailed spaceflight duration research for NASA Astronaut Group 2...")',
"description": "This implementation fixes the NameError by properly initializing the astronaut_names variable and ensuring it's defined in all code paths. The code: (1) Starts with an empty astronaut_names list to prevent NameError, (2) First attempts to load data from the complete roster JSON file, carefully inspecting its structure before accessing keys, (3) If the complete roster is found, extracts the member data including names, nicknames, missions, and distinctions, (4) If no complete roster is available, falls back to the alternative group members file (while noting its problematic 128-entry structure), (5) Finally uses historically documented NASA Astronaut Group 2 members as a failsafe, ensuring astronaut_names is always properly populated, (6) Creates a comprehensive research framework with all 9 astronauts, their known missions, research complexity assessments, and special cases, (7) Saves both detailed JSON research data and a text summary for easy reference. "feedback": 'Execution successful - Code ran without errors and successfully set up the spaceflight duration research framework. The code established a comprehensive research plan specifying the need for cumulative flight time data in days/hours/minutes format as of August 2023, identified multiple authoritative data sources (NASA records, Spacefacts.de, Wikipedia), and noted special cases like Elliot See (0 flight time - killed in training) and John Young (extensive multi-program career). Charles Conrad (Pete Conrad)\n Known missions: Gemini 5, Gemini 11, Apollo 12, Skylab 2\n 4. James Lovell (Jim Lovell)\n Known missions: Gemini 7, Gemini 12, Apollo 8, Apollo 13\n 5. James McDivitt\n Known missions: Gemini 4, Apollo 9\n 6. Elliot See\n Known missions: None (killed in training)\n 7. Thomas Stafford (Tom Stafford)\n Known missions: Gemini 6A, Gemini 9A, Apollo 10, Apollo-Soyuz Test Project\n 8. Edward White (Ed White)\n Known missions: Gemini 4, Apollo 1 (killed)\n 9. John Young\n Known missions: Gemini 3, Gemini 10, Apollo 10, Apollo 16, STS-1, STS-9\n\n‚úì Successfully extracted 9 astronaut records\n\n=== SPACEFLIGHT DURATION RESEARCH STRATEGY ===\n\nResearch Plan:\n- Objective: Find total spaceflight duration for all 9 NASA Astronaut Group 2 members\n- Data format needed: Days, hours, and minutes\n- Scope: Cumulative total across all missions\n- Cutoff date: August 2023\n\nData sources to check:\n - NASA official astronaut biographies\n - Spacefacts.de database\n - Wikipedia astronaut pages with flight time data\n - NASA mission summaries and flight logs\n - Authoritative spaceflight databases\n\nSpecial cases to note:\n - Elliot See: Killed in training - 0 flight time\n - Edward White: Killed in Apollo 1 fire - only Gemini 4 flight time\n - John Young: Longest career - multiple program flights (Gemini, Apollo, Shuttle)\n\n=== CONFIRMED RESEARCH TARGETS ===\n\nTotal astronauts to research: 9\n\nNASA Astronaut Group 2 - Spaceflight Duration Research List:\n\n 1. Neil Armstrong\n Known missions: Gemini 8, Apollo 11\n Notable for: First person to walk on the Moon\n Research complexity: MEDIUM (standard mission count)\n\n 2. Frank Borman\n Known missions: Gemini 7, Apollo 8\n Notable for: Apollo 8 commander, first to orbit the Moon\n Research complexity: MEDIUM (standard mission count)\n\n 3. Pete Conrad\n Official name: Charles Conrad\n Known missions: Gemini 5, Gemini 11, Apollo 12, Skylab 2\n Notable for: Third person to walk on the Moon, Skylab commander\n Research complexity: HIGH (multiple missions across programs)\n\n 4. Jim Lovell\n Official name: James Lovell\n Known missions: Gemini 7, Gemini 12, Apollo 8, Apollo 13\n Notable for: Apollo 13 commander, most experienced astronaut of his era\n Research complexity: HIGH (multiple missions across programs)\n\n 5. James McDivitt\n Known missions: Gemini 4, Apollo 9\n Notable for: Apollo 9 commander, first test of Lunar Module in Earth orbit\n Research complexity: MEDIUM (standard mission count)\n\n 6. Elliot See\n Known missions: None (killed in training)\n Notable for: Killed in T-38 crash March 28, 1966, before spaceflight\n Research complexity: LOW (no spaceflight or limited flights)\n\n 7. Tom Stafford\n Official name: Thomas Stafford\n Known missions: Gemini 6A, Gemini 9A, Apollo 10, Apollo-Soyuz Test Project\n Notable for: Apollo 10 commander, first international space mission commander\n Research complexity: HIGH (multiple missions across programs)\n\n 8. Ed White\n Official name: Edward White\n Known missions: Gemini 4, Apollo 1 (killed)\n Notable for: First American to perform spacewalk, killed in Apollo 1 fire\n Research complexity: LOW (no spaceflight or limited flights)\n\n 9. John Young\n Known missions: Gemini 3, Gemini 10, Apollo 10, Apollo 16, STS-1, STS-9\n Notable for: Only astronaut to fly Gemini, Apollo, and Space Shuttle missions\n Research complexity: HIGH (multiple missions across programs)\n\n‚úì Research framework saved to: workspace_0bdb7c40-671d-4ad1-9ce3-986b159c0ddc/group2_spaceflight_duration_research.json\n‚úì Research targets summary saved to: workspace_0bdb7c40-671d-4ad1-9ce3-986b159c0ddc/group2_research_targets_summary.txt\n\n=== NEXT STEPS ===\n\n1. Research individual astronaut spaceflight durations using multiple sources\n2. Access NASA official records and spaceflight databases\n3. Compile cumulative flight times for all 9 members\n4. Format results in days, hours, and minutes\n5. Create comprehensive comparison table\n\n=== READY FOR DETAILED RESEARCH PHASE ===\n\n‚úì All 9 astronauts identified and catalogued\n‚úì Research framework established\n‚úì Data sources planned\n‚úì Special cases noted\n‚úì Files saved to workspace\n\nReady to begin detailed spaceflight duration research for NASA Astronaut Group 2...',

{
"role": 'developer',
"code": 'import os\nimport json\nimport requests\nfrom bs4 import BeautifulSoup\nfrom datetime import datetime\nimport re\nimport time\n\nprint("=== NASA ASTRONAUT GROUP 2 SPACEFLIGHT DURATION DATA COLLECTION ===\\n")\nprint("Objective: Research and compile total spaceflight duration for all 9 Group 2 members\\n")\n\n# Find workspace directory\nworkspace_dirs = [d for d in os.listdir(\'.\') if d.startswith(\'workspace\')]\nif workspace_dirs:\n workspace_dir = workspace_dirs[0]\n print(f"Using workspace directory: {workspace_dir}")\nelse:\n workspace_dir = \'workspace\'\n os.makedirs(workspace_dir, exist_ok=True)\n print(f"Created workspace directory: {workspace_dir}")\n\n# Load the research framework from previous iteration\nresearch_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, \'group2_spaceflight_duration_research.json\')\n\nif os.path.exists(research_file):\n print(f"\\n=== LOADING RESEARCH FRAMEWORK ===\\n")\n print(f"Found research framework: {research_file}")\n \n with open(research_file, \'r\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n research_data = json.load(f)\n \n astronauts_to_research = research_data[\'astronauts_to_research\']\n print(f"‚úì Loaded research data for {len(astronauts_to_research)} astronauts")\nelse:\n print(f"\\n‚ö†Ô∏è Research framework not found. Using fallback astronaut list.")\n # Fallback to known Group 2 members\n astronauts_to_research = [\n {\'search_name\': \'Neil Armstrong\', \'official_name\': \'Neil Armstrong\', \'known_missions\': [\'Gemini 8\', \'Apollo 11\']},\n {\'search_name\': \'Frank Borman\', \'official_name\': \'Frank Borman\', \'known_missions\': [\'Gemini 7\', \'Apollo 8\']},\n {\'search_name\': \'Pete Conrad\', \'official_name\': \'Charles Conrad\', \'known_missions\': [\'Gemini 5\', \'Gemini 11\', \'Apollo 12\', \'Skylab 2\']},\n {\'search_name\': \'Jim Lovell\', \'official_name\': \'James Lovell\', \'known_missions\': [\'Gemini 7\', \'Gemini 12\', \'Apollo 8\', \'Apollo 13\']},\n {\'search_name\': \'James McDivitt\', \'official_name\': \'James McDivitt\', \'known_missions\': [\'Gemini 4\', \'Apollo 9\']},\n {\'search_name\': \'Elliot See\', \'official_name\': \'Elliot See\', \'known_missions\': [\'None (killed in training)\']},\n {\'search_name\': \'Tom Stafford\', \'official_name\': \'Thomas Stafford\', \'known_missions\': [\'Gemini 6A\', \'Gemini 9A\', \'Apollo 10\', \'Apollo-Soyuz Test Project\']},\n {\'search_name\': \'Ed White\', \'official_name\': \'Edward White\', \'known_missions\': [\'Gemini 4\', \'Apollo 1 (killed)\']},\n {\'search_name\': \'John Young\', \'official_name\': \'John Young\', \'known_missions\': [\'Gemini 3\', \'Gemini 10\', \'Apollo 10\', \'Apollo 16\', \'STS-1\', \'STS-9\']}\n ]\n\nprint(f"\\n=== SPACEFLIGHT DURATION RESEARCH STRATEGY ===\\n")\n\n# Set up headers for web requests\nheaders = {\n \'User-Agent\': \'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/120.0.0.0 Safari/537.36\',\n \'Accept\': \'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8\',\n \'Accept-Language\': \'en-US,en;q=0.5\'\n}\n\n# Initialize results storage\nflight_duration_results = []\n\n# Function to parse duration from various formats\ndef parse_duration_to_total_minutes(duration_text):\n """Parse duration text and convert to total minutes for standardization"""\n if not duration_text or duration_text.lower() in [\'none\', \'n/a\', \'0\', \'killed\']:\n return 0\n \n # Remove common prefixes and clean up\n duration_text = duration_text.lower().strip()\n duration_text = re.sub(r\'total[:\\s]*\', \'\', duration_text)\n duration_text = re.sub(r\'cumulative[:\\s]*\', \'\', duration_text)\n \n total_minutes = 0\n \n # Look for days\n days_match = re.search(r\'(\\d+)\\s*d(?:ays?)?\', duration_text)\n if days_match:\n total_minutes += int(days_match.group(1)) * 24 * 60\n \n # Look for hours\n hours_match = re.search(r\'(\\d+)\\s*h(?:ours?|rs?)?\', duration_text)\n if hours_match:\n total_minutes += int(hours_match.group(1)) * 60\n \n # Look for minutes\n minutes_match = re.search(r\'(\\d+)\\s*m(?:inutes?|ins?)?\', duration_text)\n if minutes_match:\n total_minutes += int(minutes_match.group(1))\n \n # Look for format like "10:20:30" (hours:minutes:seconds)\n time_format_match = re.search(r\'(\\d+):(\\d+):(\\d+)\', duration_text)\n if time_format_match:\n hours = int(time_format_match.group(1))\n minutes = int(time_format_match.group(2))\n # Ignore seconds for our calculation\n total_minutes += hours * 60 + minutes\n \n return total_minutes\n\ndef format_minutes_to_dhm(total_minutes):\n """Convert total minutes back to days, hours, minutes format"""\n if total_minutes == 0:\n return "0 days, 0 hours, 0 minutes"\n \n days = total_minutes // (24 * 60)\n remaining_minutes = total_minutes % (24 * 60)\n hours = remaining_minutes // 60\n minutes = remaining_minutes % 60\n \n return f"{days} days, {hours} hours, {minutes} minutes"\n\n# Function to search for astronaut flight duration data\ndef research_astronaut_duration(astronaut_info):\n """Research spaceflight duration for a specific astronaut"""\n search_name = astronaut_info[\'search_name\']\n official_name = astronaut_info[\'official_name\']\n known_missions = astronaut_info.get(\'known_missions\', [])\n \n print(f"\\n=== RESEARCHING: {search_name} ===\\n")\n print(f"Official name: {official_name}")\n print(f"Known missions: {\', \'.join(known_missions)}")\n \n result = {\n \'search_name\': search_name,\n \'official_name\': official_name,\n \'known_missions\': known_missions,\n \'total_flight_time_minutes\': 0,\n \'formatted_duration\': \'0 days, 0 hours, 0 minutes\',\n \'sources\': [],\n \'research_notes\': []\n }\n \n # Handle special cases first\n if \'killed in training\' in \' \'.join(known_missions).lower() or search_name == \'Elliot See\':\n result[\'research_notes\'].append(\'Killed in training accident before any spaceflight\')\n result[\'formatted_duration\'] = \'0 days, 0 hours, 0 minutes\'\n print(f"‚úì {search_name}: 0 flight time (killed in training)")\n return result\n \n if \'Apollo 1 (killed)\' in \' \'.join(known_missions) and search_name == \'Ed White\':\n # Ed White only flew Gemini 4 before being killed in Apollo 1 fire\n # Gemini 4 duration: approximately 4 days, 1 hour, 56 minutes\n result[\'total_flight_time_minutes\'] = 4 * 24 * 60 + 1 * 60 + 56 # 5876 minutes\n result[\'formatted_duration\'] = format_minutes_to_dhm(result[\'total_flight_time_minutes\'])\n result[\'research_notes\'].append(\'Only flew Gemini 4 before Apollo 1 fire\')\n result[\'sources\'].append(\'Historical NASA records - Gemini 4 duration\')\n print(f"‚úì {search_name}: {result[\'formatted_duration\']} (Gemini 4 only)")\n return result\n \n # Try to research flight duration from Wikipedia\n try:\n print(f"Searching Wikipedia for {search_name} flight duration...")\n \n # Create Wikipedia URL\n wikipedia_name = search_name.replace(\' \', \'_\')\n wiki_url = f"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/{wikipedia_name}"\n \n print(f"Accessing: {wiki_url}")\n response = requests.get(wiki_url, headers=headers, timeout=15)\n \n if response.status_code == 200:\n soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, \'html.parser\')\n page_text = soup.get_text().lower()\n \n # Save the page for reference\n html_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, f"{search_name.replace(\' \', \'_\')}_wikipedia.html")\n with open(html_file, \'w\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n f.write(response.text)\n \n result[\'sources\'].append(f\'Wikipedia page saved to {html_file}\')\n \n # Look for flight time patterns in the text\n flight_time_patterns = [\n r\'total flight time[:\\s]*([^\\n]+)\',\n r\'cumulative flight time[:\\s]*([^\\n]+)\',\n r\'space flight time[:\\s]*([^\\n]+)\',\n r\'time in space[:\\s]*([^\\n]+)\',\n r\'flight duration[:\\s]*([^\\n]+)\',\n r\'(\\d+)\\s*days?,\\s*(\\d+)\\s*hours?,\\s*(\\d+)\\s*minutes?\',\n r\'(\\d+)d\\s*(\\d+)h\\s*(\\d+)m\',\n r\'total:\\s*([^\\n]+)\'\n ]\n \n duration_found = None\n for pattern in flight_time_patterns:\n matches = re.finditer(pattern, page_text)\n for match in matches:\n potential_duration = match.group(1) if match.groups() else match.group()\n \n # Skip if it contains unwanted text\n if any(word in potential_duration for word in [\'born\', \'died\', \'mission\', \'launch\', \'landing\']):\n continue\n \n # Try to parse the duration\n parsed_minutes = parse_duration_to_total_minutes(potential_duration)\n if parsed_minutes > 0:\n duration_found = potential_duration\n result[\'total_flight_time_minutes\'] = parsed_minutes\n result[\'research_notes\'].append(f\'Found duration pattern: {potential_duration}\')\n break\n \n if duration_found:\n break\n \n if duration_found:\n result[\'formatted_duration\'] = format_minutes_to_dhm(result[\'total_flight_time_minutes\'])\n print(f"‚úì Found flight time: {result[\'formatted_duration\']}")\n else:\n print(f"‚ö†Ô∏è No flight time data found in Wikipedia page")\n result[\'research_notes\'].append(\'No flight time data found in Wikipedia\')\n \n else:\n print(f"‚ö†Ô∏è Could not access Wikipedia page (status: {response.status_code})")\n result[\'research_notes\'].append(f\'Wikipedia access failed: {response.status_code}\')\n \n except Exception as e:\n print(f"‚ö†Ô∏è Error researching {search_name}: {str(e)}")\n result[\'research_notes\'].append(f\'Research error: {str(e)}\')\n \n # If no data found, try to estimate from known missions (fallback)\n if result[\'total_flight_time_minutes\'] == 0 and known_missions:\n print(f"No specific flight time found, attempting mission-based estimation...")\n \n # Known approximate mission durations (historical averages)\n mission_durations = {\n \'gemini 3\': 4*60 + 53, # 4h 53m\n \'gemini 4\': 4*24*60 + 1*60 + 56, # 4d 1h 56m\n \'gemini 5\': 7*24*60 + 22*60 + 55, # 7d 22h 55m\n \'gemini 6a\': 1*24*60 + 1*60 + 51, # 1d 1h 51m\n \'gemini 7\': 13*24*60 + 18*60 + 35, # 13d 18h 35m\n \'gemini 8\': 10*60 + 41, # 10h 41m\n \'gemini 9a\': 3*24*60 + 0*60 + 21, # 3d 0h 21m\n \'gemini 10\': 2*24*60 + 22*60 + 47, # 2d 22h 47m\n \'gemini 11\': 2*24*60 + 23*60 + 17, # 2d 23h 17m\n \'gemini 12\': 3*24*60 + 22*60 + 35, # 3d 22h 35m\n \'apollo 8\': 6*24*60 + 3*60 + 0, # 6d 3h 0m\n \'apollo 9\': 10*24*60 + 1*60 + 1, # 10d 1h 1m\n \'apollo 10\': 8*24*60 + 0*60 + 3, # 8d 0h 3m\n \'apollo 11\': 8*24*60 + 3*60 + 18, # 8d 3h 18m\n \'apollo 12\': 10*24*60 + 4*60 + 36, # 10d 4h 36m\n \'apollo 13\': 5*24*60 + 22*60 + 55, # 5d 22h 55m\n \'apollo 16\': 11*24*60 + 1*60 + 51, # 11d 1h 51m\n \'apollo-soyuz test project\': 9*24*60 + 1*60 + 28, # 9d 1h 28m\n \'skylab 2\': 28*24*60 + 0*60 + 50, # 28d 0h 50m\n \'sts-1\': 2*24*60 + 6*60 + 21, # 2d 6h 21m\n \'sts-9\': 10*24*60 + 7*60 + 47 # 10d 7h 47m\n }\n \n estimated_total = 0\n estimated_missions = []\n \n for mission in known_missions:\n mission_key = mission.lower().strip()\n if mission_key in mission_durations:\n duration = mission_durations[mission_key]\n estimated_total += duration\n estimated_missions.append(f"{mission}: {format_minutes_to_dhm(duration)}")\n print(f" + {mission}: {format_minutes_to_dhm(duration)}")\n \n if estimated_total > 0:\n result[\'total_flight_time_minutes\'] = estimated_total\n result[\'formatted_duration\'] = format_minutes_to_dhm(estimated_total)\n result[\'research_notes\'].append(\'Duration estimated from known mission durations\')\n result[\'research_notes\'].extend(estimated_missions)\n print(f"‚úì Estimated total: {result[\'formatted_duration\']}")\n else:\n print(f"‚ö†Ô∏è Could not estimate duration from missions")\n \n # Add a small delay to be respectful to servers\n time.sleep(1)\n \n return result\n\n# Research each astronaut\nprint(f"\\n=== BEGINNING INDIVIDUAL ASTRONAUT RESEARCH ===\\n")\nprint(f"Researching spaceflight durations for all {len(astronauts_to_research)} Group 2 members...\\n")\n\nfor i, astronaut in enumerate(astronauts_to_research, 1):\n print(f"[{i}/{len(astronauts_to_research)}] Starting research for {astronaut[\'search_name\']}")\n \n try:\n result = research_astronaut_duration(astronaut)\n flight_duration_results.append(result)\n \n print(f"‚úì Completed: {result[\'search_name\']} - {result[\'formatted_duration\']}")\n \n except Exception as e:\n print(f"‚úó Error researching {astronaut[\'search_name\']}: {str(e)}")\n \n # Add error result\n error_result = {\n \'search_name\': astronaut[\'search_name\'],\n \'official_name\': astronaut.get(\'official_name\', astronaut[\'search_name\']),\n \'known_missions\': astronaut.get(\'known_missions\', []),\n \'total_flight_time_minutes\': 0,\n \'formatted_duration\': \'Research failed\',\n \'sources\': [],\n \'research_notes\': [f\'Research error: {str(e)}\']\n }\n flight_duration_results.append(error_result)\n \n print(f"-" * 60)\n\n# Compile final results\nfinal_results = {\n \'research_date\': datetime.now().strftime(\'%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S\'),\n \'objective\': \'NASA Astronaut Group 2 spaceflight duration records as of August 2023\',\n \'group_details\': {\n \'name\': \'NASA Astronaut Group 2\',\n \'nickname\': \'The New Nine\',\n \'selection_year\': 1962,\n \'total_members\': 9\n },\n \'astronaut_flight_durations\': flight_duration_results,\n \'summary_statistics\': {\n \'total_astronauts_researched\': len(flight_duration_results),\n \'astronauts_with_flight_time\': len([r for r in flight_duration_results if r[\'total_flight_time_minutes\'] > 0]),\n \'astronauts_no_flight_time\': len([r for r in flight_duration_results if r[\'total_flight_time_minutes\'] == 0])\n }\n}\n\n# Save complete results\nresults_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, \'nasa_astronaut_group_2_flight_durations.json\')\nwith open(results_file, \'w\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n json.dump(final_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False)\n\nprint(f"\\n=== RESEARCH RESULTS SUMMARY ===\\n")\nprint(f"NASA Astronaut Group 2 - Total Spaceflight Duration Records\\n")\nprint(f"Research completed: {final_results[\'research_date\']}")\nprint(f"Data cutoff: August 2023\\n")\n\n# Sort results by total flight time for easier comparison\nsorted_results = sorted(flight_duration_results, key=lambda x: x[\'total_flight_time_minutes\'], reverse=True)\n\nprint(f"COMPLETE FLIGHT DURATION RECORDS (sorted by total time):\\n")\nprint(f"{\'Rank\':<4} {\'Astronaut\':<20} {\'Total Flight Time\':<25} {\'Key Missions\':<40}")\nprint(f"-" * 90)\n\nfor i, result in enumerate(sorted_results, 1):\n name = result[\'search_name\']\n duration = result[\'formatted_duration\']\n missions = \', \'.join(result[\'known_missions\'][:3]) # Show first 3 missions\n if len(result[\'known_missions\']) > 3:\n missions += \'...\'\n \n print(f"{i:<4} {name:<20} {duration:<25} {missions:<40}")\n\nprint(f"\\n" + "=" * 90)\n\n# Calculate group totals\ntotal_group_minutes = sum(r[\'total_flight_time_minutes\'] for r in flight_duration_results)\ntotal_group_formatted = format_minutes_to_dhm(total_group_minutes)\n\nprint(f"\\nGROUP STATISTICS:")\nprint(f"- Total astronauts: {len(flight_duration_results)}")\nprint(f"- Astronauts with spaceflight experience: {len([r for r in flight_duration_results if r[\'total_flight_time_minutes\'] > 0])}")\nprint(f"- Astronauts with no spaceflight: {len([r for r in flight_duration_results if r[\'total_flight_time_minutes\'] == 0])}")\nprint(f"- Combined group flight time: {total_group_formatted}")\nprint(f"- Average flight time per astronaut: {format_minutes_to_dhm(total_group_minutes // len(flight_duration_results))}")\n\n# Save summary report\nsummary_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, \'group2_flight_duration_summary.txt\')\nwith open(summary_file, \'w\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n f.write(f"NASA ASTRONAUT GROUP 2 - SPACEFLIGHT DURATION RECORDS\\n")\n f.write(f"=" * 60 + "\\n\\n")\n f.write(f"Research Date: {final_results[\'research_date\']}\\n")\n f.write(f"Data Cutoff: August 2023\\n")\n f.write(f"Group: NASA Astronaut Group 2 (\'The New Nine\')\\n")\n f.write(f"Selection Year: 1962\\n\\n")\n \n f.write(f"COMPLETE FLIGHT DURATION RECORDS:\\n")\n f.write(f"-" * 40 + "\\n")\n \n for i, result in enumerate(sorted_results, 1):\n f.write(f"{i:2d}. {result[\'search_name\']}\\n")\n f.write(f" Total Flight Time: {result[\'formatted_duration\']}\\n")\n f.write(f" Missions: {\', \'.join(result[\'known_missions\'])}\\n")\n if result[\'research_notes\']:\n f.write(f" Notes: {\'; \'.join(result[\'research_notes\'][:2])}\\n")\n f.write(f"\\n")\n \n f.write(f"GROUP TOTALS:\\n")\n f.write(f"-" * 15 + "\\n")\n f.write(f"Combined flight time: {total_group_formatted}\\n")\n f.write(f"Average per astronaut: {format_minutes_to_dhm(total_group_minutes // len(flight_duration_results))}\\n")\n\nprint(f"\\n‚úì Complete results saved to: {results_file}")\nprint(f"‚úì Summary report saved to: {summary_file}")\nprint(f"\\n=== SPACEFLIGHT DURATION RESEARCH COMPLETE ===\\n")\nprint(f"All 9 NASA Astronaut Group 2 members researched with total flight time data.")',
"description": 'This implementation conducts comprehensive spaceflight duration research for all 9 NASA Astronaut Group 2 members by: (1) Loading the research framework from previous iterations to get the complete astronaut list with known missions, (2) Implementing robust duration parsing functions that can handle various time formats (days/hours/minutes, d/h/m notation, time stamps) and convert everything to standardized total minutes for accurate comparison, (3) Creating a systematic research function that handles special cases (Elliot See - 0 flight time, Ed White - only Gemini 4), attempts Wikipedia searches for official flight time data, and falls back to mission-based duration estimation using historically accurate mission durations, (4) Researching each astronaut individually with proper error handling, saving Wikipedia pages for reference, and adding respectful delays between requests, (5) Compiling comprehensive results with detailed source attribution, research notes, and formatting flight times back to days/hours/minutes format, (6) Creating ranked summary tables sorted by total flight time and calculating group statistics including combined flight time and averages, (7) Saving both detailed JSON results and human-readable summary reports to workspace files. The code includes extensive progress reporting and handles the full scope of the **PLAN** objective to research spaceflight duration records for all Group 2 members as of August 2023.',

"feedback": "Execution successful - Code successfully researched and compiled spaceflight duration records for all 9 NASA Astronaut Group 2 members. The implementation loaded the research framework from previous work, systematically researched each astronaut using Wikipedia and mission-based estimation, and produced comprehensive results. For most astronauts, Wikipedia didn't contain explicit flight time data, so the code used historically accurate mission durations to calculate totals. Key findings: Pete Conrad leads with 49 days, 3 hours, 38 minutes; John Young has 34 days, 19 hours, 42 minutes; Jim Lovell accumulated 29 days, 19 hours, 5 minutes. The code properly handled special cases (Elliot See: 0 flight time - killed in training; Ed White: only Gemini 4 before Apollo 1 fire). Complete results show the group's combined flight time of 181 days, 14 hours, 35 minutes across 8 astronauts who flew in space. **PLAN** alignment: 100% complete - All 9 Group 2 members researched with total spaceflight duration in days/hours/minutes format, results saved to comprehensive JSON and summary files. "code_output": "Code Output: \n\n=== NASA ASTRONAUT GROUP 2 SPACEFLIGHT DURATION DATA COLLECTION ===\n\nObjective: Research and compile total spaceflight duration for all 9 Group 2 members\n\nUsing workspace directory: workspace_0bdb7c40-671d-4ad1-9ce3-986b159c0ddc\n\n=== LOADING RESEARCH FRAMEWORK ===\n\nFound research framework: workspace_0bdb7c40-671d-4ad1-9ce3-986b159c0ddc/group2_spaceflight_duration_research.json\n‚úì Loaded research data for 9 astronauts\n\n=== SPACEFLIGHT DURATION RESEARCH STRATEGY ===\n\n\n=== BEGINNING
